result.execSummary:
Michael Jonathon Ophelan was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Michael Jonathon Ophelan was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Jonathon Ophelan

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Dan Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dan Firkus appeared for Defendant Michael J Ophelan.  Defendant Michael J. Ophelan in custody.  JP-clerk 1:18 pm Def feels not valid warrant.  Waives right, just wants it cleared up.  CT goes over papers.  Def signs papers.  CT finds Def waives right to extradition FVK.  Rev set for 12-22-15 to be sure Def has been transported.  1:24 pm adj.
Report in support of probable cause for arrest. Request for criminal complaint.
